intro: Zeuxine strateumatica f. rupicola, commonly known as the rock zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often pale yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually basal, with a distinctive trifoliate structure, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
